primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Final Judgment where the Son of Man separates humanity based on their relationship to Him through the 'least of these', resulting in the inheritance of the Kingdom.

offering his life to save us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of mercy, specifically as a 'poor specimen' needing a substitute.

tekstueel_bewijs: covering our unrighteousness with his righteousness
by his indwelling Spirit he will make us into those...
our good-deeds checklist is going to come up short
the shattered confidence of the condemned
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but the ontological reality of death and the 'insidious' nature of self-congratulatory righteousness which leads to 'eternal fire'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Stewardship response: The believer manages money as a response to Christ's Kingship.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (giving) is explicitly framed as a 'response' to the primary program (salvation/mercy). It is the fruit, not the root.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → The Kingdom → The Redeemed

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes Christ's power to save and the Spirit's power to transform, rather than the hearer's obligation to perform.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the threat of S2 (Judgment) to the failure of ~S1 (Moralism/Checklists) to the resolution in ~S2 (Christ taking the judgment) to reach S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through Substitutionary Atonement: 'The Judge judged in our place.'
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the 'eternal fire' and 'shattered confidence' are presented as real threats.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon addresses stewardship (money), it grounds the entire ethical demand in the prior, finished work of Christ as the Substitute Judge.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Compare good-deed checklists with them, yours will probably come up short.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Judge judged in our place.
Those who are vindicated... are those who are not even aware that they have done any good works.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Moritz couple and Mother Teresa are used as 'anti-examples' to prove the impossibility of moralism, rather than models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the only figure whose 'deed' counts.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude leading to spontaneous giving.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by faith alone; works as fruit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Cosmic Judge' to 'Stewardship' is perfectly bridged by the concept of 'Gratitude'.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'feeling guilty' (Eagle article) and 'not being coerced' (Sermon conclusion).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Covering our unrighteousness with his righteousness... the Judge judged in our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (ability) to become the kind of person who gives.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative (Salvation) while placing the hearer as the Subject only in the secondary, responsive narrative (Stewardship).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Devoir in the middle section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'must' of pledging is always swallowed by the 'can' of the Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already avoids 'cheap grace' by taking the judgment seriously.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It addresses a 'Law' topic (stewardship) without falling into moralism by keeping Christ as the primary Actant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'guilt' hook of the newspaper story, semiotics reveals that the story is actually used to deconstruct the hearer's Subject-status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the meaning of 'brethren'; semiotics focuses on the reversal of the Judge/Judged roles.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that 'gratitude' is the bridge that prevents the secondary program from overriding the primary program.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively by making Christ the subject of the most critical salvific verbs.
